The following goal setting principles will help to effectively set and accomplish your goals.
REALISTIC: The goal must be able to be reasonably accomplished. Setting goals too high will erode confidence from non-achievement. Setting Goals too low will not build confidence if too easy.
MEANINGFUL: The goal must be something of value to you or the benefactor of the accomplishment.
MEASURABLE: The goal must have a measurable result to identify that it is accomplished.
TIMED: The goal must identify a specific time that it will be accomplished.
COPY EXISTING GOAL: To copy one of your existing goals or a predefined company goal, enter the goal # to be copied and click the "Copy" button. All tasks and reminder notes will be duplicated.

Member Success Tracks pre-define any business process as a series of steps with due dates and email reminders for a member. Mentors can follow-up and be notified for accomplishments.
Customer Success Tracks pre-define any business process as a series of follow-up steps with due dates and email reminders for a customer.
Import Success Tracks
All Success Tracks in the "Import/Goal" Folder will be imported to the following company and member.
